name: Business Angels Europe
goal:
BAE is the confederation of national Business Angels Associations and Federations, which represent the key angel groupings in their own countries.
BAE National Members represent 90% of the organised angel market in Europe: ABAF (Austria); AEBAN (Spain); APBA (Portugal); BAND (Germany); BAN Nederland (Netherlands); BeBAN (Belgium); France Angels (France); IBAN (Italy); LINC Scotland; Polish Federation of Business Angels (Poland); UK Business Angels Association (UK).

BAEâ€™s core objectives are:
- Building the capacity of angel investing in Europe
- Promoting quality and good practices in angel investment
- Supporting an effective environment for cross-border investing
- Improving data and research on angel financing in Europe.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Culture and media, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
- Capital Markets union (CMU)
- European Innovation Council
- Pilot co-investment fund with Business Angels
- Research on Business Angels
- Capacity building measures to promote business angels
- European Angels Fund (EAF)
- Start Up Europe
- ESIF and EFSI
- State aid for venture capital
- SME and entrepreneurship policy
- Women angel investment and entrepreneurship
- SME finance
- COSME, Horizon 2020, financial instruments.
